content:
Hi! I am a final year undergraduate student at BITS Pilani, Goa, India. I am currently pursuing my undergraduate thesis at Microsoft Research, Bangalore, India with Sunayana Sitaram and Monojit Choudhury. Previously, I have interned at the MT-NLP Lab, IIIT Hyderabad and Liveweaver, Pune.
My current research interests include (but aren’t limited to) : multilingual NLP with a focus on low resource languages and code-mixed language processing. I have also briefly dabbled with multimodal processing and look forward to exploring it in the future. For more details, feel free to reach out to me on my email :)
Publications GLUECoS: An Evaluation Benchmark for Code-Switched NLP  Simran Khanuja, Sandipan Dandapat, Anirudh Srinivasan, Sunayana Sitaram, Monojit Choudhury ACL â€™20 | 2020 Annual Conference of the Association for Computational LinguisticsPaper |Code  A New Dataset for Natural Language Inference from Code-mixed Conversations  Simran Khanuja, Sandipan Dandapat, Sunayana Sitaram, Monojit Choudhury LREC ‘20 | CALCS Workshop : International Conference on Language Resources and EvaluationPaper  Unsung Challenges of Building and Deploying Language Technologies for Low Resource Language Communities  Pratik Joshi, Christain Barnes, Sebastin Santy, Simran Khanuja, Sanket Shah, Anirudh Srinivasan, Satwik Bhattamishra, Sunayana Sitaram, Monojit Choudhury, Kalika Bali ICON ‘19 | 2019 International Conference on Natural Language ProcessingPaper  Dependency Parser for Bengali-English Code-Mixed Data enhanced with a Synthetic Treebank  Urmi Ghosh, Dipti Misra Sharma, Simran Khanuja TLT, SyntaxFest 2019 | 18th International Workshop on Treebanks and Linguistic TheoriesPaper |Code

title: Simran Khanuja
